Key Match Events: Jordan McLaughlin: 11 points, one assist, one rebound, one steal on 4/6 FG, 1/2 3P
Trey Lyles: 13 points, five rebounds, three assists on 5/7 FG, 3/5 3P
Keon Ellis: Nine points, two rebounds, two blocks on 4/5 FG, 1/1 3P
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Brown emphasized the importance of playing with pace, and McLaughlin's speed and ball handling fit well into that style.
Coach Brown trusts Lyles to make shots at a high level and believes the floodgates are open for him.
Coach Brown is happy that McLaughlin played well and showed that he deserves an opportunity to be on the floor.
Post-Match Reflections: Kevin Huerter said that Lyles's confidence is back, and they need him.
Coach Brown is transparent about his active search for the right formula for his rotation this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sacramento Kings bench has been underwhelming to start the 2024-25 NBA season, but with injuries, they had to go deeper into their bench.
The Kings will need their bench to continue to step up for their upcoming In-Season Tournament matchups.
Others: The Kings will play four group play games before the tournament enters the knockout stage on December 10th.
The Kings' next game is against the Minnesota Timberwolves on Friday night at Golden 1 Center.
